form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES
form.official-title: To authorize the Administrator of the National Aeronautics and Space Administration to conduct a pilot program for investment in infrastructure projects at the Kennedy Space Center and to establish the Infrastructure Investment Fund, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Space Ready Act.

paragraph.text: The term Administration means the National Aeronautics and Space Administration.
The term Administrator means the Administrator of the National Aeronautics and Space Administration.
The term NASA means the National Aeronautics and Space Administration.

section.header: Pilot program for infrastructure investments at Kennedy Space Center and establishment of Infrastructure Investment Fund

subsection.text: The Administrator may conduct a pilot program for private and public investment in specific infrastructure projects at the Kennedy Space Center.

paragraph.text: There is established in the Treasury of the United States a fund, to be known as the Infrastructure Investment Fund (referred to in this subsection as the Fund), for infrastructure investments of the National Aeronautics and Space Administration.

subparagraph.text: The Administrator may include in agreements entered into under section 20113(e) of title 51, United States Code, involving transactions that support public and commercial activities at the Kennedy Space Center, an assessment to fund specific capital repair, maintenance, and improvement projects described in paragraph (3).
Each assessment collected under subparagraph (A) shall be deposited into the Fund and shall remain available until expended.

Amounts deposited in the Fund shall be used by the Administrator to conduct capital repairs, maintenance, and improvements to NASA-owned infrastructure at the Kennedy Space Center, as the Administrator considers necessary to support activities conducted under agreements entered into under section 20113(e) of title 51, United States Code, which may include renovation, rehabilitation, sustainment, demolition, construction, operation, maintenance, repair, enhancement, expansion, and modernization of NASA-owned infrastructure at the Kennedy Space Center.
Improvements made to NASA-owned infrastructure at the Kennedy Space Center with amounts from the Fund shall be property of the United States.

paragraph.text: Not later than 180 days after the date of the enactment of this Act, and annually thereafter, the Administrator shall submit to the Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation of the Senate and the Committee on Science, Space, and Technology of the House of Representatives a report on the Fund that includes the following:

clause.text: the total amount collected and deposited into the Fund under paragraph (2); and
the total expenditures made from the Fund.

subparagraph.text: The amount in the Fund as of the date on which the report is submitted.
The proposed uses of amounts in the Fund for the operating plans of the Administration.
The authority to collect assessments under paragraph (2)(A) shall terminate on December 31, 2035.

The expiration under subparagraph (A) of the authority to collect assessments may not be construed to otherwise affect the validity or terms of agreements under section 20113(e) of title 51, United States Code, or the retention or use by the Administration of proceeds from such agreements.
